title: Angelman syndrome
summary: Angelman syndrome or Angelman's syndrome[1][2] (AS) is a genetic disorder that mainly affects the nervous system.[6] Symptoms include a small head and a specific facial appearance, severe intellectual disability, developmental disability, limited to no functional speech, balance and movement problems, seizures, and sleep problems.[6] Children usually have a happy personality and have a particular interest in water.[6] The symptoms generally become noticeable by one year of age.[6]
